extendedInfo.description: Test LED trackball colors.**Only works on phones that support colored LED notifications. For example Samsung Galaxy S3, Galaxy S4, Galaxy Note 2, Galaxy Nexus, Nexus 4** *Allows custom colors*Gives color code.*No ads.Note: For your led light to work, check that the 'Pulse notification light' setting under your phone's 'Display' or 'Sound' settings is enabled.Note: There are reports from Galaxy Nexus that this app doesn't work when the app  "Light Flow" is installed. Try temporarily uninstalling it if you experience this.Note: WILL NOT change LED colors for sms, calls etc. Try the app called "Light Flow" or "Blink" for many types of notifications.NOTE: Remove from task killers.

reviews.title: Works well.
reviews.comment: Most colors work on the Droid Razr Hd. I think it\'s unfair that many people are rating this 1 star simply because there phones don\'t support any led colors. It\'s a hardware issue, not a software issue.
reviews.author: Ryan Graziano

reviews.title: HTC One
reviews.comment: Doesn\'t work for the new HTC One. It only blinks Green no matter what. The only LED colors it seems to have are Green (notifications) and Orange/Red (Charging/Dying). I rated 4 stars because the app works, just not for this phone.
reviews.author: Eric Becerra

reviews.title: HTC
reviews.comment: Didn\'t work on htc incredible s. I\'m perty sure the led only has green and orange anyway but wouldn\'t even make it go.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: HTC EVO 4G Lte
reviews.comment: Doesn\'t support these phones..dry everyone tested n still comes up green had to rate as ,1 I know this sucks for people thinking make sure u know what type of phone that\'s supports this app..
reviews.author: Steven Beck

reviews.title: Pick a color, see a color
reviews.comment: Installed it to my Nexus 4 just to see if the LED had that functionality, which it does. Another great little app for testing the phone.
reviews.author: Adam Stovicek

reviews.title: Impressive/Excellent
reviews.comment: An Excellent Way to test the LED (on my Galaxy SIII) works with every color, custom colors, and even the grayscale...all on the LED...I\'m impressed.
reviews.author: Bo Broadnax

reviews.title: Works on my sony live with walkman
reviews.comment: phone need to be at sleep mode(locked) to test. but all the led apps are like that (beside sony buildin). bottom line, it do what is supposed to do, and doing it good.
reviews.author: liad stein

reviews.title: this sucks!!!
reviews.comment: I have a T-mobile my touch 4g slide and doesn\'t work at all... waste of time!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nice little tester.
reviews.comment: Works as it should.  (If your phone has a rgb norification led. Note, not all phones follows the \"android standard\" for rgb led.)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.comment: Worked great on my Motorola Electrify. The color White did not work on my phone, which, of course, is not this app\'s fault. It is a great tester to see if any colors worked other than the ones already on the phone. Thank you for creating an app that didn\'t require any permissions. Off to check out an app to use these colors...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent! Tmobile Galaxy S3
reviews.comment: Great app Have confirmed galaxy s3 can produce the following colors perfectly; Green, Red, Blue, Yellow, Cyan, White, Magenta(looks Pink), Purple Thanks a lot! Once again excellent! The Orange is not displayed correctly, but it appears to be hardware related more then software related. The red cannot shine enough to over power the green, yellow is produced instead. ***********EDIT************ Can produce Orange perfectly Just that there needs to be close to no color other than red.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Awesome App
reviews.comment: Works On Droid Razr Maxx Green=Perfect Red=Perfect Blue=Great/Slight Purple In a Spot Yellow=Fair/Rainbowlike Orange=Fair/Rainbowlike Cyan=Great/Slight Green In a Spot White=Fair/Slight Green and Purple In a Spot Pink=Perfect Purple=Great/Slight Blue In a Spot
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: galaxy tab2 7.1
reviews.comment: failed,it not show any colour
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Disapointing
reviews.comment: My phone (evo 3d) supports green and amber leds,the app does not allow me to change the green led notification to red for sms etc
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Good app. Wonder why Samsung didn\'t give us an option to choose colour for yourself in your phone\'s menu lol hopefully they\'ll get it fixed in jelly bean. Thanks Dev
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Slows down!
reviews.comment: Slows down my phone waay to much...I mean its dope..worked to test my lights..sadly had to take it off :0/
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work on Xperia Z
reviews.comment: LED won\'t turn on. Lightflow manages to control LED fine.
reviews.author: Johnny Cardenas

reviews.title: Nice test but.....
reviews.comment: Testing works fine, but colors are not accurate.  Make sure you have \"missed event\" checked in LED settings.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Didn\'t work.
reviews.comment: I followed the simple instructions & it didn\'t work. I checked the Pulse Notification Light, put the phone to sleep & it didn\'t work. App is useless & I\'m uninstalling.
reviews.author: Debra Shaw

reviews.title: Works with S III
reviews.comment: Don\'t let the rating throw you off; Color Tester works on my phone, The Galaxy S III.  It\'s easy to use and requires no explanation; Choose a color (or type a hexadecimal number) then lock your phone, then shortly afterwards, the light should light up the closest color.  All if it works, so perfect; 5 stars.
reviews.author: Xane Myers
